article:
The story happened when I was 16.When I was leaving the train station with my father, a woman 16 _  near to us and said that her money had been stolen.She asked  _   my father could lend her some money to go back home.My father 18 _  her what she asked and told her not to worry about 19 _  it back.
I was 20 _ .How could my own father be so easily cheated? It was 21 _  to me that she was lying, staying in the 22 _  all day long to catch the next fool.
"She was 23 _ !" I screamed. "Why did you give her anything 24 at all ?"
My father looked at me and I could 25 _ that he was a bit angry."And what would you like me to 26 _  ?" he said, "Should I tell her that I am a college professor and that I can 27 see through  her cheating?" I did not 28 _ him at all, and then he told me 29 _  that I would never forget."First, she would not do this if she did not need the 30 _ .Second, I made her happy, because now she thinks that she is 31 _  than me, and I do not mind that.I think that is more 32 _  to her than the money."
A week later, we were at the same 33 _ , and the same woman came up to my father with the same 34 _ ."Not this time," my father told her, "In your business, you have to learn to 35 _  people.Try another story on me next week."
Well, he was a professor, after all...and I like both sides of this story: generosity  and wisdom.
